Description: Fragment of shoulder of East Greek pottery closed vase; creamy slip; at top, maeander band; below, painted decoration consisting of goat (horn remaining), to right; pendant lozenge and undetermined motif at right; pendant triangle filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.033)
